text: The only thing that you absolutely have to know is the location of the library.
author: Albert Einstein

text: A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies. The man who never reads lives only one.
author: George R.R. Martin

text: You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view.
author: Harper Lee

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exup√©ry

text: So many books, so little time.
author: Frank Zappa

text: If you don't imagine, nothing ever happens at all.
author: John Green

text: I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realizes an emotion at the time.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass.
author: Anton Chekhov

text: We read to know we're not alone.
author: William Nicholson
